name: ssl-client-auth-demo
description: This demonstrates [Client-authenticated TLS handshake](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transport_Layer_Security#Client-authenticated_TLS_handshake) which allows you to sign in without the use of passwords or e.g. email roundtrips, plus it allows to "uniquely identify yourself to third-party websites without giving the second party any account information" [(Hofstetter 2008)](http://pilif.github.com/2008/05/why-is-nobody-using-ssl-client-certificates/). All of this using already existing infrastructure built in to all major web browsers.
